intro: Neltuma hassleri var. hassleri, commonly known as the Hassler's neltuma, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with cool climates. Its leaves are finely divided and possess a distinctive, often fragrant, aroma. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically unique species.
